Detailed Description

APIs to allocate frame buffer memory from a predefined memory pool

Function Documentation

Ptr BspUtils_memAlloc ( UInt32  size,
UInt32  align 
)

Allocate memory from memory pool.

Parameters
size[IN] size in bytes
align[IN] alignment in bytes
Returns
NULL or error, else memory pointer
Int32 BspUtils_memCheckHeapStat ( const BspUtils_MemHeapStatus *  heapStat)

Checks the current status of each heap with the value passed.

BspUtils_memCheckHeapStat This returns an error if the values of each of the heap doesn't match. This function could be called before calling the module init function or after module deinit function.

Parameters
heapStat[IN] Older status to be compared with the current status.
Returns
Returns 0 if the heap sizes match else return BSP_EFAIL.
Int32 BspUtils_memClearOnAlloc ( Bool  enable)

Control if allocated buffer needs to be cleared to 0.

By default allocated buffer will not be cleared to 0

Parameters
enable[IN] TRUE: clear allocated buffer, FALSE: do not clear allocated buffer
Returns
0 on sucess, else failure
Int32 BspUtils_memDeInit ( void  )

One time system de-init of memory allocator.

Should be called by application at system de-init

Returns
0 on sucess, else failure
Int32 BspUtils_memFrameAlloc ( Fvid2_Format *  pFormat,
Fvid2_Frame *  pFrame,
UInt32  numFrames 
)

Allocate a frame.

Use Fvid2_Format to allocate a frame. Fill Fvid2_Frame fields like chNum based on Fvid2_Format

Parameters
pFormat[IN] Data format information
pFrame[OUT] Initialzed Fvid2_Frame structure
numFrames[IN] Number of frames to allocate
Returns
0 on sucess, else failure
Int32 BspUtils_memFrameFree ( const Fvid2_Format *  pFormat,
Fvid2_Frame *  pFrame,
UInt32  numFrames 
)

Free's previously allocate Fvid2_Frame's.

Parameters
pFormat[IN] Data format information
pFrame[IN] Fvid2_Frame structure
numFrames[IN] Number of frames to free
Returns
0 on sucess, else failure
Int32 BspUtils_memFrameGetSize ( const Fvid2_Format *  pFormat,
UInt32 *  size,
UInt32 *  cOffset 
)

Returns the memory required to allocate a single buffer as per provided format.

This will be used by the BspUtils_memFrameAlloc() function and application could use this function to find out the memory allocated for a frame.

Parameters
pFormat[IN] Data format information
size[OUT] Size in bytes needed per frame. This parameter can't be NULL.
cOffset[OUT] Returns the chroma buffer offset in case of YUV planar/semi-planar formats. If this parameter is NULL, the value is not returned.
Returns
0 on sucess, else failure
Int32 BspUtils_memFree ( Ptr  addr,
UInt32  size 
)

Free previously allocate memory pointer.

Parameters
addr[IN] memory pointer to free
size[IN] size of memory pointed to by the memory pointer
Returns
0 on sucess, else failure
void BspUtils_memGetHeapStat ( BspUtils_MemHeapStatus *  heapStat)

Returns the current status (free size) of the various heaps used.

BspUtils_memGetHeapStat This function could be called before calling the module init function or after module deinit function.

Parameters
heapStat[OUT] Status filled by the function.
Int32 BspUtils_memInit ( void  )

One time system init of memory allocator.

Should be called by application before using allocate APIs

Returns
0 on sucess, else failure
Int32 BspUtils_memInit_internal ( UInt32 *  pMemAddr,
UInt32  memSize 
)

Init heap with user specified memory area.

This API is used internally by BspUtils_memInit() and BspUtils_memInit_largeHeap() so typically user's will NOT use this API directly

Int32 BspUtils_memInit_largeHeap ( void  )

One time system init of memory allocator.

Should be called by application before using allocate APIs. This is same as BspUtils_memInit(), except that a larger heap size is used. Right now only chains app will used this large heap. When using large heap a different config.bld needs to be used. For chains app this is setup via Makefile's in HDVPSS driver build system.

Only ONE of BspUtils_memInit() or BspUtils_memInit_largeHeap() should be called during system init.

Returns
0 on sucess, else failure
